intro: Linum trigynum, commonly known as the three-sepal flax, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Linaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are composed of five sepals that are united at the base, forming a distinctive cup-like structure. Linum trigynum is often found in meadows and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
